question: Which are the only two countries that share land borders with El Salvador?
explanation: Guatemala and Honduras are the only two countries that share land borders with El Salvador. El Salvador is a country located in Central America bordered by Honduras to the northeast and Guatemala to the northwest. These are the only two countries that share land borders with El Salvador. The Pacific Ocean forms the coastline of El Salvador to the south. El Salvador is the smallest Central American country and the only one without a coastline on the Caribbean Sea. El Salvador is known as the "Land of Volcanoes" because of the frequent earthquake and volcanic activities and it has more than 20 volcanoes within its boundaries and two of them are currently active. The capital of El Salvador is San Salvador, which is the country's political, cultural, educational and financial centre. The official currency of El Salvador is the United States Dollar. The official language of El Salvador is Spanish.
